hero.subtitle: On Your Walls
hero.description: Upload a photo of your room, select from curated artworks, and see exactly how each piece will look in your space before you buy.

visualizer.title: Wall Art Visualizer
visualizer.description: Upload your wall photo, choose your artwork, and customize the frame and size to see a realistic preview.

tips.title: How to Take the Perfect Photo
tips.description: Follow these tips to get the most accurate preview of how your chosen artwork will look on your wall.

faceWall.title: Face the Wall Directly
faceWall.description: Stand perpendicular to the wall for minimal distortion. Avoid angled shots.

distance.title: Stand 6-10 Feet Away
distance.description: For best results, stand 2-3 meters (6-10 ft) from the wall. This captures the whole wall with proper perspective.

lighting.title: Natural Lighting
lighting.description: Take photos during daylight hours. Avoid harsh shadows or flash.

reference.title: Include Reference Points
reference.description: Include furniture or objects to help gauge size. Small: 30-50cm, Medium: 50-80cm, Large: 80-120cm width.

steady.title: Hold Steady
steady.description: Keep your phone level and steady. Use grid lines if available.

fullWall.title: Capture Full Wall Section
fullWall.description: Ensure the entire wall area where you want the painting is visible. Include some floor and ceiling for context.

proTip.title: Pro Tip
proTip.description: For the best results, take multiple photos from the same position and choose the sharpest one. A clear, well-lit photo will give you the most realistic preview of your artwork placement.

footer.text: Visualize the perfect artwork for your space
